description:
`eox-map` offers a built-in tooltip, which needs to be placed inside the default slot:
```
<eox-map [...]>
<eox-map-tooltip></eox-map-tooltip>
</eox-map>
```
The tooltip feature supports Vector, VectorTile, WebGLTile, and (wms) Tile layers.
when hovering or clicking a feature, the tooltip will be updated with the feature properties.
This renders a list of all feature properties of the currently selected feature.
Note that if multiple interactions are registered (e.g. `pointermove` and `singleclick`),
the `pointermove` interaction will have higher priority for the tooltip.
snippet:
<eox-map>
  <eox-map-tooltip></eox-map-tooltip>
</eox-map>

<script type="module">
  import "@eox/map/dist/eox-map.js";

  const eoxMap = document.querySelector("eox-map");

  // Assign properties
  Object.assign(eoxMap, {
    layers: [
      {
        type: "Vector",
        source: {
          type: "Vector",
          url: "https://openlayers.org/data/vector/ecoregions.json",
          format: "GeoJSON",
        },
        interactions: [
          {
            type: "select",
            options: {
              id: "selectInteraction",
              condition: "pointermove",
              style: {
                "stroke-color": "red",
                "stroke-width": 3,
              },
            },
          },
        ],
      },
    ],
    center: [15, 48],
    zoom: 4,
  });
</script>

description:
The rendering of feature properties inside the tooltip can be transformed
by passing a `propertyTransform` function to the tooltip element which applies to each property in the rendering loop:
```
<eox-map [...]>
<eox-map-tooltip
.propertyTransform=${({key, value}, feature) => key.includes("COLOR") ? { key: key.toLowerCase(), value }}
></eox-map-tooltip>
</eox-map>
```
The first argument are `key` and `value` of the current feature property; this object needs to be
returned in order to render the property in the list.
Additionally, the entire feature is passed as a second argument, for cases of more advanced property
transformation in which needs access to the entire feature.
snippet:
<eox-map>
  <eox-map-tooltip></eox-map-tooltip>
</eox-map>

<script type="module">
  import "@eox/map/dist/eox-map.js";

  const eoxMap = document.querySelector("eox-map");
  const eoxMapTooltip = document.querySelector("eox-map-tooltip");

  // Assign properties
  Object.assign(eoxMap, {
    layers: [
      {
        type: "Vector",
        source: {
          type: "Vector",
          url: "https://openlayers.org/data/vector/ecoregions.json",
          format: "GeoJSON",
        },
        interactions: [
          {
            type: "select",
            options: {
              id: "selectInteraction",
              condition: "pointermove",
              style: {
                "stroke-color": "red",
                "stroke-width": 3,
              },
            },
          },
        ],
      },
    ],
    center: [15, 48],
    zoom: 4,
  });

  Object.assign(eoxMapTooltip, {
    propertyTransform: (param) => {
      if (param.key.includes("COLOR")) {
        return { key: param.key.toLowerCase(), value: param.value };
      }
      return undefined;
    },
  });
</script>

description: Demonstrates the @init event, allowing custom initialization logic (e.g., map projection setup) when the story or embedded elements are initialized.
snippet:
<eox-storytelling
  markdown='## Map section <!--{as="eox-map" projection="ESRI:53009" style="width: 100%; height: 500px;" config='{ "controls": { "Zoom": {}, "Attribution": {}, "FullScreen": {}, "OverviewMap": { "layers": [ { "type": "Tile", "properties": { "id": "overviewMap" }, "source": { "type": "OSM" } } ] } }, "layers": [ { "type": "Tile", "properties": { "id": "overviewMap" }, "source": { "type": "TileWMS", "url": "https://ows.mundialis.de/services/service", "params": { "LAYERS": "TOPO-WMS" } } } ], "view": { "center": [15,48], "zoom": 1 } }'}-->

## Map Tour section <!--{ projection="ESRI:53009" as="eox-map" zoom="9" center=[12.46,41.89] mode="tour" layers='[{"type":"Tile","properties":{"id":"osm"},"source":{"type":"OSM"}}]' }-->

### <!--{ projection="ESRI:53009" animationOptions="{duration:500}" }-->
#### ESRI:53009

### <!--{ projection="EPSG:3857" animationOptions="{duration:500}" }-->
#### EPSG:3857

### <!--{ projection="EPSG:4326" animationOptions="{duration:500}" }-->
#### EPSG:4326
'
  id="markdown-init-event"
></eox-storytelling>

<script type="module">
  import "@eox/storytelling/dist/eox-storytelling.js";

  function initEventFunc(element) {
    if (element?.tagName === "EOX-MAP") {
      element.registerProjection(
        "ESRI:53009",
        "+proj=moll +lon_0=0 +x_0=0 +y_0=0 +a=6371000 +b=6371000 +units=m +no_defs",
      );
      const projection = element.getAttribute("projection");
      if (projection) element.setAttribute("projection", projection);
    }
  }

  const eoxStorytelling = document.querySelector("eox-storytelling");

  // Listen for events
  eoxStorytelling.addEventListener("init", (e) => initEventFunc(e.detail));
</script>

description:
Date filtering using eox-itemfilter for filtering timeline items by metadata properties
This example shows how to use the `<eox-itemfilter>` component in conjunction with timecontrol
to filter timeline items based on metadata properties (e.g., cloud coverage). The filter
component allows users to set filter criteria, and the timeline automatically updates to
show only matching items.
The calendar picker also respects the filter, showing dots only for dates that have data
matching the current filter criteria. Filtered-out dates are displayed with reduced opacity.
snippet:
<eox-timecontrol for="eox-map#external-map-rendering-mosaic">
  <eox-timecontrol-date></eox-timecontrol-date>
  <eox-timecontrol-picker></eox-timecontrol-picker>
  <eox-timecontrol-timeline></eox-timecontrol-timeline>
  <eox-itemfilter></eox-itemfilter>
</eox-timecontrol>
<eox-map id="external-map-rendering-mosaic"></eox-map>

<script type="module">
  import "@eox/timecontrol/dist/eox-timecontrol.js";
  import "@eox/map/dist/eox-map.js";
  import "@eox/itemfilter/dist/eox-itemfilter.js";

  const eoxTimecontrol = document.querySelector("eox-timecontrol");
  const eoxMap = document.querySelector("eox-map");
  const eoxTimecontrolDate = document.querySelector("eox-timecontrol-date");
  const eoxTimecontrolPicker = document.querySelector("eox-timecontrol-picker");
  const eoxTimecontrolTimeline = document.querySelector(
    "eox-timecontrol-timeline",
  );
  const eoxItemfilter = document.querySelector("eox-itemfilter");

  // Assign properties
  Object.assign(eoxTimecontrol, {
    layerIdKey: "id",
    titleKey: "name",
    filters: [
      {
        key: "cloudCoverage",
        title: "Cloud Coverage",
        type: "range",
        expanded: true,
        min: 0,
        max: 100,
        step: 5,
        state: {
          min: 0,
          max: 40,
        },
      },
    ],
    externalMapRendering: true,
    animate: true,
    select: (e) => {
      console.log(e.detail);
    },
  });

  Object.assign(eoxMap, {
    zoom: 10,
    center: [12, 42],
  });

  Object.assign(eoxTimecontrolDate, {
    navigation: true,
  });

  Object.assign(eoxTimecontrolPicker, {
    range: true,
    showDots: true,
    popup: true,
  });
</script>

description:
Calendar date picker displayed in popup mode and shows items in the popup
This example demonstrates the `<eox-timecontrol-picker>` component with `showItems` enabled.
The calendar appears as a popup overlay when clicking on the date input field (provided by
`<eox-timecontrol-date>`). The picker shows items in the popup.

description:
Expert example showcasing all timecontrol features together
This comprehensive example demonstrates all available timecontrol components and features:
- Date display with navigation
- Calendar picker in popup mode with dots
- Range slider for date selection
- Timeline visualization
- Timelapse export functionality
- Date filtering
This example serves as a reference for building complex time navigation interfaces with
multiple interaction methods and visualization options.
snippet:
<eox-timecontrol for="eox-map#external-map-rendering-mosaic">
  <eox-timecontrol-date></eox-timecontrol-date>
  <eox-timecontrol-picker></eox-timecontrol-picker>
  <eox-timecontrol-timeline></eox-timecontrol-timeline>
  <eox-timecontrol-timelapse></eox-timecontrol-timelapse>
  <eox-itemfilter></eox-itemfilter>
</eox-timecontrol>
<eox-map id="external-map-rendering-mosaic"></eox-map>

<script type="module">
  import "@eox/timecontrol/dist/eox-timecontrol.js";
  import "@eox/map/dist/eox-map.js";
  import "@eox/itemfilter/dist/eox-itemfilter.js";

  const eoxTimecontrol = document.querySelector("eox-timecontrol");
  const eoxMap = document.querySelector("eox-map");
  const eoxTimecontrolDate = document.querySelector("eox-timecontrol-date");
  const eoxTimecontrolPicker = document.querySelector("eox-timecontrol-picker");
  const eoxTimecontrolTimeline = document.querySelector(
    "eox-timecontrol-timeline",
  );
  const eoxTimecontrolTimelapse = document.querySelector(
    "eox-timecontrol-timelapse",
  );
  const eoxItemfilter = document.querySelector("eox-itemfilter");

  // Assign properties
  Object.assign(eoxTimecontrol, {
    layerIdKey: "id",
    titleKey: "name",
    filters: [
      {
        key: "cloudCoverage",
        title: "Cloud Coverage",
        type: "range",
        expanded: true,
        min: 0,
        max: 100,
        step: 5,
        state: {
          min: 0,
          max: 40,
        },
      },
    ],
    externalMapRendering: true,
    animate: true,
    select: (e) => {
      console.log(e.detail);
    },
  });

  Object.assign(eoxMap, {
    zoom: 10,
    center: [12, 42],
  });

  Object.assign(eoxTimecontrolDate, {
    navigation: true,
  });

  Object.assign(eoxTimecontrolPicker, {
    range: true,
    showDots: true,
    popup: true,
  });
</script>

description:
External map rendering mode for timelapse export with custom map rendering logic
This example demonstrates the `externalMapRendering` feature, which allows custom handling
of map layer updates for timelapse export. When enabled, the timecontrol dispatches an
`export` event with detailed information about selected items, allowing external code to
handle the map rendering and snapshot generation.
This is useful when you need custom control over how map layers are rendered for each
time step, or when using map rendering services that require special handling.
snippet:
<eox-timecontrol for="eox-map#external-map-rendering-mosaic">
  <eox-timecontrol-timeline></eox-timecontrol-timeline>
  <eox-timecontrol-date></eox-timecontrol-date>
  <eox-timecontrol-picker></eox-timecontrol-picker>
</eox-timecontrol>
<eox-map id="external-map-rendering-mosaic"></eox-map>

<script type="module">
  import "@eox/timecontrol/dist/eox-timecontrol.js";
  import "@eox/map/dist/eox-map.js";

  const eoxTimecontrol = document.querySelector("eox-timecontrol");
  const eoxMap = document.querySelector("eox-map");
  const eoxTimecontrolTimeline = document.querySelector(
    "eox-timecontrol-timeline",
  );
  const eoxTimecontrolDate = document.querySelector("eox-timecontrol-date");
  const eoxTimecontrolPicker = document.querySelector("eox-timecontrol-picker");

  // Assign properties
  Object.assign(eoxTimecontrol, {
    layerIdKey: "id",
    titleKey: "name",
    externalMapRendering: true,
    animate: true,
    select: (e) => {
      console.log(e.detail);
    },
  });

  Object.assign(eoxMap, {
    zoom: 10,
    center: [12, 42],
  });

  Object.assign(eoxTimecontrolDate, {
    navigation: true,
  });

  Object.assign(eoxTimecontrolPicker, {
    range: true,
    showDots: true,
    showItems: true,
    popup: true,
  });
</script>

description:
No map story
This example demonstrates the timecontrol component without a map. The component can be used
standalone by providing `controlValues` directly instead of linking to a map via the `for` attribute.
This is useful when you want to use timecontrol for date selection without map integration.
snippet:
<eox-timecontrol>
  <eox-timecontrol-date></eox-timecontrol-date>
  <eox-timecontrol-picker></eox-timecontrol-picker>
  <eox-timecontrol-timeline></eox-timecontrol-timeline>
  <eox-timecontrol-slider></eox-timecontrol-slider>
  <eox-itemfilter></eox-itemfilter>
</eox-timecontrol>

<script type="module">
  import "@eox/timecontrol/dist/eox-timecontrol.js";

  const eoxTimecontrol = document.querySelector("eox-timecontrol");
  const eoxTimecontrolDate = document.querySelector("eox-timecontrol-date");
  const eoxTimecontrolPicker = document.querySelector("eox-timecontrol-picker");
  const eoxTimecontrolTimeline = document.querySelector(
    "eox-timecontrol-timeline",
  );
  const eoxTimecontrolSlider = document.querySelector("eox-timecontrol-slider");
  const eoxItemfilter = document.querySelector("eox-itemfilter");

  // Assign properties
  Object.assign(eoxTimecontrol, {
    layerIdKey: "id",
    titleKey: "name",
    filters: [
      {
        key: "cloudCoverage",
        title: "Cloud Coverage",
        type: "range",
        expanded: true,
        min: 0,
        max: 100,
        step: 5,
        state: {
          min: 0,
          max: 40,
        },
      },
    ],
    navigation: true,
    popup: true,
    position: ["bottom", "left"],
    select: (e) => {
      console.log(e.detail);
    },
  });

  Object.assign(eoxTimecontrolDate, {
    format: "YYYY-MM-DD",
    navigation: true,
  });

  Object.assign(eoxTimecontrolPicker, {
    format: "YYYY-MM-DD",
    showDots: true,
    popup: true,
    position: ["bottom", "left"],
  });
</script>

description:
Range slider for selecting date ranges with visual indicators for years and months
This example demonstrates the `<eox-timecontrol-slider>` component, which provides a visual
range slider for selecting start and end dates. The slider displays tick marks for years and
months, and tooltips show the formatted dates when hovering over or dragging the handles.
The slider automatically extracts available dates from timeline items and allows users to
select a date range by dragging the handles. The selected range is immediately applied to
the map layers.

description:
Timeline visualization using vis-timeline with date picker and calendar integration
This example shows the full power of the timecontrol component with the `<eox-timecontrol-timeline>`
component. The timeline displays timeline items as milestones grouped by layer, allowing users
to visualize time-based data across multiple layers.
Features demonstrated:
- Timeline visualization with groups and items
- Date picker with dots indicating available data (`showDots` attribute)
- Date display with navigation buttons
- Range selection via custom time markers on the timeline
- Click events on timeline items to select specific dates
The timeline automatically syncs with the date picker and other components, providing a
comprehensive time navigation interface.

description:
Update view event story
This example demonstrates the `update:view` event, which is dispatched when the view range of the timeline changes.
The event is dispatched with the start and end dates of the view range.
